definition: TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Hideyoshi himself brought along two portable teahouses in starkly contrasting styles.
sentences.chinese: 豐臣秀吉本人帶來了兩個風格截然不同的便攜式茶館。

sentences.english: Wanli emperor decided was conferring the king of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 萬曆帝決定冊封豐臣秀吉爲日本國王。

sentences.english: In Japan, hideyoshi understand Japanese situation in north Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，豐臣秀吉瞭解了日軍在朝鮮的戰況。

sentences.english: Hideyoshi was also a great and enthusiastic patron of many arts.
sentences.chinese: 豐臣秀吉同時還是許多藝術的熱心贊助人。

sentences.english: In Japan, hideyoshi celebrate son pill was born.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，豐臣秀吉慶賀兒子拾丸誕生。

sentences.english: The invasion of Hideyoshi (Japan) and others led to"The Hermit Kingdom."
sentences.chinese: 日本豐臣秀吉與其他民族入侵這隱士王國。

definition: ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
Okayama prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
